name: Randall Bramblett
description: '''Randall Bramblett''' (born 1948) is an American musician and singer-songwriter, whose career as a solo artist, [[session musician|session player]], and touring musician, has spanned five decades.  He has worked with [[Gregg Allman]], [[Bonnie Raitt]], [[Goose Creek Symphony]], [[Robbie Robertson]], [[Elvin Bishop]], [[Steve Winwood]], [[Bonnie Bramlett]], [[B.J. Thomas]], [[Widespread Panic]], [[Jay E.  Livingston]] and [[Roger Glover]]. He plays keyboards, saxophones, flute, guitar, mandolin, and harmonica, and his songwriting is influenced by blues, folk, and gospel music.
